sentences.en: Finally, exhausted and exhilarated , he soon fell into a mercifully dreamless sleep.
sentences.cn: 最后, 他觉得困乏了,可还是喜孜孜的, 终于很快就昏昏沉沉地睡着了.

sentences.en: He dealt with the thief mercifully.
sentences.cn: 他对待那个小偷很宽容.

sentences.en: He even pretends to mercifully show sympathy towards those innocent lives lost in the riots.
sentences.cn: 还假装慈悲向在暴乱中丧生的无辜生命表示同情.

sentences.en: It was a mercifully quick end for those condemned to die.
sentences.cn: 对于那些死刑犯来说,这是一种仁慈的快速解脱.

sentences.en: Mercifully some one arrived upon the scene to extricate him from the dilemma and assume the responsibility.
sentences.cn: 幸亏有个人来替他解围,把责任包揽下来.

sentences.en: Mercifully the florist says she cannot reveal the name of the sender.
sentences.cn: 此时,我真想一头钻进电脑键盘里去.

sentences.en: Mercifully, I managed to stop the car just in time.
Mercifully, I remembered his name just in time.
sentences.cn: 好加在, 我刚好及时记起了他的名字.

sentences.en: Mercifully, the gallop slows to a canter as modern times approach.
sentences.cn: 令人大受欢迎的是,当现代临近之时, 快步放缓,转向慢跑.

sentences.en: Nixon proceeded to respond, mercifully more tersely than Brezhnev.
sentences.cn: 尼克松开始作出回答了.幸运的是, 他讲的比勃列日涅夫简练.

sentences.en: Or did the darkness mercifully conceal such a horror as the MacIntosh house?
sentences.cn: 或者这黑暗好意地把一幅像麦金托什家住宅那样的惨象给遮住了?

sentences.en: The play was very bad, but mercifully it was also short!
sentences.cn: 那剧糟透了, 幸好还不算长!

words.tran_cn: 仁慈，宽容；怜悯；幸运；善行

trans.tran_en: fortunately or luckily, because a situation could have been much worse
